p: Furthermore, evaluation of the data indicated that only nine samples (4% of all soil samples) had an NPI < 0.7, which were classified as non-pollution. Approximately 8% and 6% of all soil samples were on the NPI warning line and suggested low-level pollution, respectively, whilst 44% and 38% of all samples had an NPI between 2 and 3 and NPI ≥ 3, respectively, which indicates moderate and high levels of pollution.
